for your safety
Flying with an airline is safe but it is advisable that you should know what to do
in an emergency. Safety measures are legally required in Air Travel as in other
forms of transport. Your safety in our care is our first concern.
smoking: Smoking is allowed except during ground manoeuvres, take - off.
landing and sometimes in flight. An illuminated sign in your cabin will indicate
when not to smoke.
Cigarettes only are permittec
seat belts: The seat belt must always be fastened during take-off and landing
and occasionally when turbulent air conditions are encountered. An Illuminated
sign will tell vou when seat belts must be tastened; at other times it is wise C
keep them fastened unless it is inconvenient.
hand baggage: Apart from clothing and similar light articles, baggage must
not be olaced on the racks as this may cause inur in turbulence
portable electronic equipment: Operation of portable radios or similar
equipment is not allowed as this may interfere
